sense.name: (Cause to) oscillate between two states, directions, or attitudes.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to Sense 3; in Sense 1 the thing alternating is singular. NOTE: This sense must imply MOTION.
sense.examples: I can't get the current to alternate. I alternate between loving Helga and wishing her dead. The army alternated back and forth across the river.

sense.name: (Cause to) alternate in function or role.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] ALTERNATE NP2[patient] for NP3[patient] NP1[actor] ALTERNATE for NP2[actor] NP1[agent] ALTERNATE NP2[patient[plural]]
sense.examples: Harry alternated Sally for Diana at the diner. He alternated for Louise at last night's show. The business alternated the security guards on different days of the week.

sense.name: Two entities exchange positions in turn or by set intervals.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to Sense 1; in Sense 3 the thing alternating is plural.
sense.examples: We alternate on the night shift. The skaters alternated down the ice. Candles and flowers alternated along the table.
